nodes.text: The crackdown on Pipada was the response of the Galactic Empire to the Drabatans of the planet Pipada after they protested the establishment of the Empire, including the young and popular singer Sa'Kalla. The Empire blockaded Pipada and deployed garrisons of swamptroopers to the surface, and what began as protests, turned into massacres. During the crackdown, Sa'Kalla was captured, and a movement was created in her name.

After believing that they had tortured Sa'Kalla into submission, the governor of Pipada brought her out in front of an audience of half a million Drabatans in the Pipada Auditorium, ordering her to convince the people to submit. Sa'Kalla instead shouted for the people to resist Imperial rule and was quickly executed.

The whole stadium erupted, leading to uprisings that tore Imperial security forces to pieces, and briefly reclaimed their world before the Empire later arrived with reinforcements and imposed martial law.

The crackdown on Pipada was first mentioned in Dawn of Rebellion, a canon roleplaying 2018 sourcebook that is based on Star Wars Rebels and Rogue One: A Star Wars Story. The book was published by Fantasy Flight Games and was authored by John Dunn, Tom Sorenson, Sterling Hershey, Jonathan Julius, Keith Ryan Kappel, Tim Huckelberry, Jason Marker, and James M. Spahn.
